message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CV 

The paper presents a method for learning to approximate a Bayes filter using neural networks, which falls under the category of neural networks (cs.NE). The paper also discusses the use of maximum likelihood and stochastic gradient descent, which are common techniques in machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper's focus on filtering and prediction also suggests that it could fall under the category of control systems (cs.SY). Finally, the paper mentions the development of tuning curves consistent with experimental neuroscience, which could indicate a connection to computer vision (cs.CV).
